Neville Chamberlain, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir John Simon, K.C., I The Right Hon. Viscount Halifax,M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer. The War Cabinet had before them a Joint Report by theForeign Office and the Chiefs of Staff (W.P. (40) 59).A record of the discussion which took place and of the con-clusions reached is contained in the Secretary's Standard File ofWar Cabinet Conclusions.9 i) *ir*jRelease ofBritishPrisonersfrom S.S." Altmark."(previous reference:W.M. (40) 44thConclusions,Minute 2.)2. The Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs said that hehad been asked to provide a statement which could be broadcastfrom this country to Scandinavia that afternoon. He read out acopy of a statement which had been authorised.The Foreign Secretary said that he thought it would bedesirable to issue a further statement to the Press, on the general lines of what he had said to the Norwegian Minister, but in a moreimpersonal form. The Foreign Secretary read to the Cabinet adraft statement which he had prepared.Various amendments were agreed to in discussion.The War Cabinet were informed, that the broadcasts on theAltmark episode in Scandinavia had been restrained, and that the tone of the broadcasts from neutral countries generally had been satisfactory.The War Cabinet Authorised the Foreign Secretary to issue to the Press thedraft statement which he had prepared, subject to the amendments suggested in discussion.Scandinavia.(previous reference:W.M. (40) 21stConclusions,Minute 12.)3. The War Cabinet had before them a Memorandum by theFirst Lord of the Admiralty on the Stoppage of Traffic in norwegian Territorial Waters (W.P. (40) 60).The Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs said that he had only just received this Memorandum and would like further time toconsider it. He thought it was clear that the timing of theoperation, which the First Lord suggested, would be a matter ofgreat importance.The War Cabinet-Decided to defer consideration of the First Lord's paper for a few days.Richmond Terrace, S. W. 1,February 18, 1940.
